NAME: Macallan - 72 Year Old Lalique Genesis Decanter
DESCRIPTION:
In the year 2018 Macallan, the most famous brand in whisky, opened a new award willing £140 Million Pound distillery. This is the second release to celebrate this great occasion. The first release was the Macallan Genesis, where people travelled from all over the globe to be in with a chance of securing such an elusive bottle. There were even rumours of people swimming across the river Spey to secure their spot in the line. This is the second release and is one of only 600, also going under the Genesis name.
At the time of writing this piece, this is the oldest ever Macallan to be bottled in what can only be described as a piece of art. This Genesis Lalique decanter holds liquid that was distilled in the 1940s and lay to mature for an exceptional 72 years. The distillery has won multiple awards for its design and architecture and the bottle shape/character certainly reflects its unique design. Burgess Studio was given the honour of designing such a unique piece of history and its vessel for transport was designed and crafted by NEJ Stevenson.
Macallan said: "Lalique has captured the character of the new Distillery in crystal, with the horizon of the decanter rising and falling in reflection of the roof line and incorporating the clean lines and natural curves. Each decanter is encased in a bespoke presentation case inspired by the interior of the Distillery, with a curved wooden roof over the decanter, and a footprint taken directly from the circular layout of the three new still houses."
 Nick Savage, Master distiller at the time said - ‘For its 72 years of maturation, the deceptively light colour hints that this is not an ordinary single malt. Reminiscent of a time gone by, it carries an exquisite balance of strong, sweet oak with the peaty spirit shaping its refined character.’

NAME: S.S Politician - Whisky Galore 1940's
DESCRIPTION:
A very exciting and rare bottling where you have a chance to own a piece of whisky history! The bottle comes from one of the most famous shipwrecks in history, the S.S Politician. 
The SS Politician ran aground off the shores of Eriskay in the Outer Hebrides in 1941.
The salvage operation by divers, islanders, and the efforts of custom and excise officials to frustrate this, inspired the novel Whisky Galore. This was adapted for cinema in 1949 and again in 2016.
The bottle was recovered by diver George Currie, director of Currie Brothers Limited and can be seen in the picture bottom left. While working on a subsea cable repair from South Uist - Eriskay, the team located the wreck. 
George said: "As you can see with the smile on our faces, it was a great days diving". 
Everyone in the whisky world is well aware of the significance of the SS Politician, which is why its story has been adapted for cinema twice. The whisky onboard ranged from Gilbey’s, Ballantine’s, VAT 69 and more. 
This lot comes with the original poster, diving helmet and bricks from the ship.

NAME: Château Pichon Lalande 1992 - 12 x 75cl
DESCRIPTION: The vineyard in AOC Saint-Julien is located on a low plateau and is situated next to Cussac. The soil here, in most plots, is remarkably similar to Lotour. Built in 1565, this Chateau was by Bishop Francois de Foix-Candale. There has been quite a few owners in its colourful history and at the time of writing this, the drinks giant Suntory and castle group are mutual shareholders of Grands millésimes de France. This vineyard covers 90 hectares and boasts a grape variety of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 31% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. Found in the Médoc region, Château Beychevelle has become one of the leading names! Château Beychevelle has a high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and a touch of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot to give a great finish. Found to be very well balanced and delicate, the vineyard has a very strict selection process by choosing only the highest calibre of grapes.

NAME: Macallan - 1954  - Campbell, Hope and King
DESCRIPTION:
The most collectable single malt in the world, Macallan currently holds the record for the most expensive single malt ever sold at auction. 
The distillery is owned by the Edrington Group who purchased it in 1999 from Highland Distillers. 
This bottling was distilled in 1957 and bottled Campbell, Hope and King Ltd who were based in Edinburgh in the 19th century & into 20th century. The company also had premises in New Elgin from which the relationship with Macallan would have blossomed. Prior to the 1980s the bottling of Macallans product was subcontracted out to independent bottlers.

NAME: Brora - 22 Year Old 1972 58.7%
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
There are five Rare Malt Broras released and it is said that 1972 vintage is quite frankly exceptional.  This Brora 22 year old was bottled at 58.7% ABV.

NAME: Macallan - 1954  - Campbell, Hope and King
DESCRIPTION:
The most collectable single malt in the world, Macallan currently holds the record for the most expensive single malt ever sold at auction. 
The distillery is owned by the Edrington Group who purchased it in 1999 from Highland Distillers. 
This bottling was distilled in 1957 and bottled Campbell, Hope and King Ltd who were based in Edinburgh in the 19th century & into 20th century. The company also had premises in New Elgin from which the relationship with Macallan would have blossomed. Prior to the 1980s the bottling of Macallans product was subcontracted out to independent bottlers.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old Anniversary Malt (1958/1959) Bottled 1985
DESCRIPTION: This is an incredibly rare 25 year old Speyside single malt.  It was distilled at The Macallan in 1958/1959.  It was bottled in 1985 for the highly decorated Anniversary Malt range. This a 75cl bottle.

NAME: Macallan - Diamond Jubilee 2012
DESCRIPTION: A highly desirable, limited-edition release from Macallan to commemorate the Golden Jubilee of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II (1952-2012). This is one of 2012 bottles. Drawn from its cask on the 8th of February 2012, by no coincidence the date of Her Majesty’s accession, this sherry cask-matured expression was bottled at 52% ABV.  It is an instant classic and highly collectable.

NAME: Craigellachie - 39 Year Old Exceptional Cask Series 1980 51.5%
DESCRIPTION:
A 39 year old from the Speyside distillery that in 2017 this distillery was awarded World's Best Single Malt at the World Whiskies Awards.
It has been matured in both first-fill and refill casks, and bottled at cask strength.
If you have never been to Craigellachie make sure you stop at The Highlander Inn, you will not be disappointed!
This is part of their exceptional cask series and was distilled in 1980. This is one of only 138 bottles.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 1966
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 1966, this 18 year old has fully matured in sherry wood casks before being bottled. This is a 75cl bottling at 43% ABV. This bottling is now old and rare.

NAME: Macallan - 30 Year Old - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This 2019 release from The Macallan is aged exclusively in Oloroso sherry seasoned casks from Jerez for all thirty years of its maturation. Resultingly, it is said to have a beautiful Oloroso sherry presence after this extended ageing. It is a naturally dark, Speyside single malt full of rich dried fruits, spice and wood smoke.

NAME: The Macallan M - 1824 Series
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan M comes in a crystal decanter designed by renowned fashion and luxury goods designer Fabien Baron and crafted by Lalique, who have also worked with Macallan on The Macallan in Lalique Collection. This comes presented in a deluxe box and with a crystal stopper.
The final premium release within Macallan's 1824 series of whiskies.  
In true Macallan fashion the M Decanter is incredibly elegant and impressive to look at, without even considering the contents.  The crystal decanter is designed by Fabien Baron a well known French Director and Art Director and created by Lalique.  It is one of the more difficult decanters to produce as it requires a 15 stage finishing process.
The Macallan M is limited to only 1,750 bottles each year and carries Macallan's reputation of exceptional quality whisky proudly.

NAME: Glen Moray - 2015 Barrel #253 -  161.25 Bulk L 62.0% | Held In Bond
DESCRIPTION:
Glen Moray - 2015 Barrel #253 -  161.25 Bulk L 62.0% | Held In Bond
A great chance to be the new owner of a 5 Year Old Glen Moray Single Malt Cask, held in bond at Whisky Broker.
Filled on the 03/06/2015, cask #253 has been maturing very nicely and was re-gauged on the 13/08/2020. 
 There a few key facts and figures that have been listed below for your attention -
 If bottled at cask strength and at 70cl, this cask would approximately yield 230 bottles of 5 Year Old Glen Moray Single Malt. 
Whiskybroker is currently holding this cask and the storage fee is £0.28 per week with insurance at £0.0035 a year per £1 of the value of the cask.
The buyer is responsible for the £20 administration fee is payable to Whiskybroker. 
 Please Note -

NAME: Chichibu - 2012 Bourbon Cask #2012 - Intergalactic Edition 3 (& Face Mask)
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled exclusively for Salud Distribution comes the third edition of the ChiChibu Intergalactic series. Filled from a single first-fill bourbon barrel (#2012), Edition 3 has the lowest outturn of the series with a total of just 162 bottles produced. Distilled in 2012 and released in 2020, this bottle is sure to live up to the hype!
This is Chichibu Intergalactic Series 2002 - Edition 3.

This lot comes with a Chichibu Face Mask.

NAME: Chichibu - 2012 Bourbon Cask #2334- Intergalactic Edition 4 (& Face Mask)
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled exclusively for Vienna Distribution comes the fourth edition of the Chichibu Intergalactic series. Filled from a single first-fill bourbon barrel (#2334). This is one of 213 bottles produced.
Distilled in 2012, this is the final bottle that makes up this four-part series!

NAME: Ardbeg - 2005 Single Oloroso Cask #4704
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask Ardbeg was distilled on 26th December 1975 and bottled at 29 years old on 14th April 2005.  Matured in single ex-Oloroso Sherry cask #4704.  This is one of just 270 bottles filled.
This is bottle number 214.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 1979 Gran Reserva
DESCRIPTION:
This vintage from Macallan was distilled in 1979 and bottled in 1997. 
Regarded as one of the most recognisable whiskies in the world today.
Looking to start a collection? Look no further...

NAME: Johnnie Walker - The Directors Blend 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Johnnie Walker Directors Blends were exclusively given to Diageo executives and as such, they are the one of the rarest and most sought after Johnnie Walker bottlings.  This is the very first release from 2008. The Directors Blends are very hard to find series that are stunning addition to any collection.
This is bottle number 142.

NAME: Rosebank - 27 Year Old Cask #433 53.3%
DESCRIPTION:
Cask Number 433 has "aromas of vanilla, mango, raspberry, barley sugar and lavender, leading to flavours of cranachan, lemon, floral notes, marzipan and faint spice, with citrus, ripe fruit and oak."
One of only 280 bottles released from Rosebank distillery in 2020 comes to this 27-year-old single cask. It was matured in a refill bourbon barrel and was part of a ballot to 100 members of the public. 
Rosebank has been doing very well at auction of late and this may be attributed to restoration of the distillery getting underway in November 2019.
This is bottle number 46.

NAME: Rosebank - 27 Year Old Cask #433 53.3%
DESCRIPTION:
Cask Number 433 has "aromas of vanilla, mango, raspberry, barley sugar and lavender, leading to flavours of cranachan, lemon, floral notes, marzipan and faint spice, with citrus, ripe fruit and oak."
One of only 280 bottles released from Rosebank distillery in 2020 comes to this 27-year-old single cask. It was matured in a refill bourbon barrel and was part of a ballot to 100 members of the public. 
Rosebank has been doing very well at auction of late and this may be attributed to restoration of the distillery getting underway in November 2019.
This is bottle number 48.

NAME: Jura - 30 Year Old 1966 - Signatory
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
BOTTLER: Signatory Vintage Scotch Whisky Co. Ltd.
DESCRIPTION: This Single Malt Whisky was distilled at Isle of Dura Distillery on the 24/05/1966 and then 30 years later, was drawn from the cask to be put into this bottle. It is one of 365 bottles and is from cask number 1868/69.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1974 Provenance 1st Release
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg distillery, found on the south coast of Islay, has been producing whisky since 1798. The commercial aspect of the distillery began production in 1815 and for most of its history the whisky was used for blends rather than as a single malt.In the 1800s Ardbeg was producing 300,000 gallons a year. However, tough times throughout the Scotch Whisky industry followed and the distillery closed for quite sometime. However, Glenmorangie PLC saw the calibre of the distillery and purchased it in 1996. It then was bought over by the French giants LVMH on the 28th of December 2004.
Michael "Mickey" Heads, an Islay originally and he was a former manager at Jura who had worked at Ardbeg years earlier, took over on 12 March 2007 until 2020. The new manager, Colin Gordon is set to take over the helm and drive e the company forward to even greater success.
1 of 4 legendary Provenance bottlings from Ardbeg. It was distilled in 1974 and released in 1997 - 2000. This specific bottling was bottled on 18th November 1997 and is the first release.
 
Bottle 4780.

NAME: Château Beychevelle 1982 - 12 x 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
The vineyard in AOC Saint-Julien is located on a low plateau and is situated next to Cussac. The soil here, in most plots, is remarkably similar to Lotour. Built in 1565, this Chateau was by Bishop Francois de Foix-Candale. There has been quite a few owners in its colourful history and at the time of writing this, the drinks giant Suntory and castle group are mutual shareholders of Grands millésimes de France. This vineyard covers 90 hectares and boasts a grape variety of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 31% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. Found in the Médoc region, Château Beychevelle has become one of the leading names!
Château Beychevelle has a high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and a touch of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot to give a great finish. Found to be very well balanced and delicate, the vineyard has a very strict selection process by choosing only the highest calibre of grapes.
Please note the shipping weight for this lot is 25kgs.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Waterford Collection (including Pilgrimage) (8 x70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes 8 x 70cl bottlings (& 5cl sample):
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland. Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.
Bannow Island: Edition 1.2 - the second Bannow Island release by Waterford. Now 3 months older, this expression is from barley grown by Ed Harpur on the extreme southern coast of Co. Wexford, where salt-laden Atlantic winds and sandy soils create a unique, if challenging, terroir.

NAME: Bowmore - Bicentenary
DESCRIPTION: The Bicentenary Bowmore is often said to be one of the best Bowmores ever bottled. It was released to celebrate 200th year of Bowmore Distillery.  It is 75.7 proof & 26 2.3 Fl oz. An increasingly rare bottle.

NAME: Macphail's - 50 Year Old 1937 Gordon & Macphail
DESCRIPTION:
Well...what can we say! An absolutely stunning piece of whisky history some would say. One of the oldest single malts from the Gordon and Macphail range, this single malt was distilled in 1937 at a Speyside distillery (supposedly Macallan actually) and was bottled in 1988. 
 
 
 
This is bottle number 74.

NAME: Macallan - 1997 Exceptional Cask #14/03 - 2019 Release
DESCRIPTION:
This series is widely recognised as one of the most collectable not just among Macallan fanatics but whisky enthusiasts all around the world. 
This ESC release has the reference is 2019/ESB-14/03 and is one of only 606 bottles.
It was distilled on the 13th January 1997 and bottled 22+ years later in August 2019. It was matured in a single European oak sherry butt.

NAME: Macallan - 14 Year Old - 2011 Easter Elchies
DESCRIPTION:
The 2011 Easter Elchies edition was distilled in 1997 and matured in Sherry butt casks before being bottled at 14 years old. The bottle is presented with the purple bow and wax emblem. 
This bottle is popular with collectors as only 550 of these limited edition bottles were made available to visitors to the Macallan estate between November -December 2011.

NAME: Macallan - Coronation (60th Anniversary) 2 x 35cl
DESCRIPTION:
This Macallan limited edition commemorates the 60th anniversary of Elizabeth II's coronation in 1953.  The Windsor red, blue and gold packaging was designed by David Holmes. 
The pack contains 2 x 35cl bottles:

NAME: Macallan - Coronation (60th Anniversary) 2 x 35cl
DESCRIPTION:
This Macallan limited edition commemorates the 60th anniversary of Elizabeth II's coronation in 1953.  The Windsor red, blue and gold packaging was designed by David Holmes. 
The pack contains 2 x 35cl bottles:

NAME: Port Ellen - 37 Year Old - 1978 16th Annual Release
DESCRIPTION:
From one of Scotland’s lost distilleries, this Port Ellen is a very rare release and soon will be even more sought after when the distillery reopens. This is from Diageo’s yearly release of Port Ellen. It was distilled in 1978 and is 37 Years Old. This is an individually numbered bottle and is one of only 2,940 bottles produced. This lot comes with the original presentation box.
Bottle 1994.

NAME: Karuizawa - 1999 - 2000 Vintages Cask Strength 31st Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Known for their sublime whiskies, winning award after international award, Karuizawa have released close to 300 single casks.
As the demand increases along with their popularity, their availability decreases with collectors scrambling.
This is a limited release Karuizawa bottled at cask strength from 1999 - 2000 vintages. This is part of their Thirty-Six Views of Mount Fuji Series.

NAME: Karuizawa - 1999 - 2000 Vintages Cask Strength 31st Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Known for their sublime whiskies, winning award after international award, Karuizawa have released close to 300 single casks.
As the demand increases along with their popularity, their availability decreases with collectors scrambling.
This is a limited release Karuizawa bottled at cask strength from 1999 - 2000 vintages. This is part of their Thirty-Six Views of Mount Fuji Series.

NAME: Karuizawa - 1999 - 2000 Vintages Cask Strength 31st Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Known for their sublime whiskies, winning award after international award, Karuizawa have released close to 300 single casks.
As the demand increases along with their popularity, their availability decreases with collectors scrambling.
This is a limited release Karuizawa bottled at cask strength from 1999 - 2000 vintages. This is part of their Thirty-Six Views of Mount Fuji Series.

NAME: Karuizawa - 1999 - 2000 Vintages Cask Strength 31st Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Known for their sublime whiskies, winning award after international award, Karuizawa have released close to 300 single casks.
As the demand increases along with their popularity, their availability decreases with collectors scrambling.
This is a limited release Karuizawa bottled at cask strength from 1999 - 2000 vintages. This is part of their Thirty-Six Views of Mount Fuji Series.

NAME: Bowmore - 8 Year Old - Sherriff's (1970s) + Mini
DESCRIPTION:
An old bottling Bowmore from the days before the distillery was sold to Stanley P Morrison. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.  Highly collectable and hugely sought after.
This lot also includes a mini at 70 proof and 1 2/3 FL OZ.

NAME: Ardbeg - 2000 Single Cask #2/2000
DESCRIPTION:
"This very rare malt whisky from Ardbeg distillery is drawn from Geert Béro's cask and bottled exclusively for Oldies & Goldies"
Bottled for Oldies & Goldies and Geert Béro this first fill bourbon barrel (cask #2) that was distilled in 2000 and this is one of 221 bottles charged on the 27th of March - which is International Whisky Day. 
This is bottle number 214.

NAME: Macallan - Genesis (2018)
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

NAME: Bowmore - 30 Year Old - Sea Dragon
DESCRIPTION:
One of Islay's most iconic bottlings and most certainly one of Bowmore's. Both the bottle and the dragon depicted on the front are somewhat legends.
First seen in the 1990's  the liquid contained inside is from 1960's No.1 Vaults.

NAME: Bowmore - 1997 - 22 Year Old - Devil's Cask #666 - Hand Filled - Feis Ile 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is a very limited release and a very much surprise release by Bowmore for many during the 2019 Fèis Ìle.  It is a hand filled bottling from Devil's Cask #666, it was matured for 22 matured in a single sherry cask. 
 
This is bottle number 212.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 2
DESCRIPTION: Released as a distillery exclusive in 2017, this retro-style bottle from The Macallan is part of the Archival Series, recreating some of the distillery's vintage advertising campaigns. This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

NAME: Redbreast - 32 Year Old Dream Cask 50cl 1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Butt
DESCRIPTION:
This Dramcask is a mix of unmalted and malted barley which have been triple distilled in copper pot stills. Single pot stills are hugely popular releases from Midleton in Ireland. 
Matured in an American oak ex-bourbon barrel for 26 years. It then spent a finishing period in an Oloroso sherry-seasoned butt.
Moving with the times, this dram was part of a Facebook Live Whiskey tasting in 2017.
The cask #41207 was released for purchase a year later. 
816 bottles were produced and this is number 
In presentation box with pin badge.

NAME: Port Ellen - 12th Release - 32 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Port Ellen 1979 32 Year Old 11th Release and is in excellent condition.
Distilled in 1979 and bottled in 2011 (32 years later)
This cask strength bottling is limited to 2988 bottles.
Port Ellens closure in 1983 has enabled this distillery to receive a huge amount of love and respect. 
This bottle is very highly rated among drinkers and collectors alike.
This bottle is number 335 out of 2964.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Bannow, Ballykilcavan,  Ratheadon 1.1  & Pilgrimage 70cl & 5cl
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 4 x 70cl bottlings:

NAME: Port Ellen - 8th Release - 29 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Port Ellen 1978 29 Year Old 8th Release.
The incredibly popular Port Ellen annual releases, this is number 8.
Distilled in 1978 and bottled 29 years later in 2008, bottled at cask strength and limited to 6,618 bottles.

NAME: Ardbeg - Auriverdes Gold Edition
DESCRIPTION: This special edition Ardbeg single malt was released on Ardbeg Day 2014. during Feis Ile.  Auri(Gold) verdes (Green) it refers to the golden whisky and the iconic Ardbeg green bottle of Ardbeg whisky.  It is said to be a dram of two halves -  the whisky uses toasted cask lids to create Mocha Coffee flavours that team up with creamy vanilla.

NAME: Macallan - 30 Year Old SMWS 24.140 Sublime Nectar
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt is from Macallan and has been aged for 30 years in a refill sherry butt. One of only 565 and given the title of Sublime Nectar.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

NAME: Port Ellen - 11th Release - 32 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Port Ellen 1979 32 Year Old 11th Release and is in excellent condition.
Distilled in 1979 and bottled in 2011 (32 years later)
This cask strength bottling is limited to 2988 bottles.
Port Ellens closure in 1983 has enabled this distillery to receive a huge amount of love and respect. 
This bottle is very highly rated among drinkers and collectors alike.

NAME: Macallan - Exceptional Single Cask 2017/ESB-7802/11 2005
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Chosen by one of the master distillers, Sarah Burgess and made available to only the USA and Asia. The European Sherry Oak cask was laid down on the 18th of May 2005 and eventually bottled at its cask strength 63.4%.
Only 552 bottles were produced and filled on the 20th Dec 2017.

NAME: Macallan - Exceptional Single Cask 2017/ESB-7802/11 2005
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Chosen by one of the master distillers, Sarah Burgess and made available to only the USA and Asia. The European Sherry Oak cask was laid down on the 18th of May 2005 and eventually bottled at its cask strength 63.4%.
Only 552 bottles were produced and filled on the 20th Dec 2017.

NAME: Macallan - Exceptional Single Cask 2017/ESB-7802/11 2005
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Chosen by one of the master distillers, Sarah Burgess and made available to only the USA and Asia. The European Sherry Oak cask was laid down on the 18th of May 2005 and eventually bottled at its cask strength 63.4%.
Only 552 bottles were produced and filled on the 20th Dec 2017.

NAME: Macallan - 1974 Speymalt - G&M
DESCRIPTION:
A classic from the independent bottler Gordon and MacPhail's.
This 1974 vintage Macallan is part of the Speymalt range, bottled in 2016.  Gordon & MacPhail purchased the Macallan new-make spirit to be matured in their own oak casks.

NAME: Brora - 38 Year Old - 2016 Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Brora 38 Year Old was released in 2016 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?
This bottle is number 381 out of 2984.

NAME: GlenDronach - 29 Year Old - 1989 Kingsman Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The GlenDronach Kingsman Edition 1989 Vintage was created by master blender Rachel Barrie in partnership with Kingsman film franchise director Matthew Vaughn. The release of the whisky follows the launch of Kingsman Edition 1991 Vintage in 2017, which marked the release of the second film in the series, Kingsman: The Golden Circle.
The new expression is bottled at 50.1% ABV and made from a selection of six casks from 1989. The 29-year-old single malt was matured initially in oloroso Sherry casks followed by a final maturation in Pedro Ximénez casks from Spain. 
Limited to 3,052 bottles and bears the emblem from the Kingsman films. The gift box has been signed by Barrie and Vaughn.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 1985
DESCRIPTION:
The start of this series began in 1982 and quite possibly the most recognisable malt in the world, The Macallan 18 Year Old. The 18 year old in the tube packaging is one of 6 releases of this kind, depicting Sara Middletons view of the estate on the front.
Distilled in Speyside, within touching distance of Easter Elchies house and fully matured in Sherry oak cask from Jerez, Spain.
This malt was distilled in 1985 and subsequently bottled in 2003.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak 2018 release is part of Macallan's super popular Sherry Oak range.  This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 
An interesting fact about The Macallan’s curiously small spirit stills is that they are the smallest in Speyside. They have this unique size and shape to give the spirit maximum surface area contact with the copper.  This, in turn, helps to concentrate on the ‘new make’ spirit.  It will provide the viscosity and rich, fruity, full-bodied flavours so characteristic of The Macallan.

NAME: Brora - 37 Year Old - 2015 Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Brora 37 Year Old was released in 2015 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?
This bottle is number 491 out of 2976.

NAME: Springbank - 1994 Douglas Laing XOP The Black Series
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Douglas Laing super premium range and the Xtra Old Particular brand comes this Springbank was distilled in November 1994 . It was a single sherry Hogshead that was bottled in May 2019. This is one of only 148 bottles.
Too many people surprise there is no artificial colouring added to this bottle and could quite possibly be the reason behind this particular bottling lines name.
 
Bottle number 104.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 3
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Folio 3 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2018.  It is the third release in the Folio series.
The theme of the Folio 3 is Macallan's advertising campaigns from the 1980s and 1990s.  The presentation includes a book containing the best of these.  The illustration on the box is from an advert used in a Victorian-era edition of Punch Magazine.  It is intended to capture the sentiment that whisky is best produced in cold weather - a remark that Macallan claim was made on their very own estate at Easter Elchies.
As with the previous Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak 2018 release is part of Macallan's super popular Sherry Oak range.  This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 
An interesting fact about The Macallan’s curiously small spirit stills is that they are the smallest in Speyside. They have this unique size and shape to give the spirit maximum surface area contact with the copper.  This, in turn, helps to concentrate on the ‘new make’ spirit.  It will provide the viscosity and rich, fruity, full-bodied flavours so characteristic of The Macallan.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This is the 2019 edition of Macallan's 25 Year Old Sherry Oak. It comes with a stunning wooden presentation box.  It's matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry oak casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak 2018 release is part of Macallan's super popular Sherry Oak range.  This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 
An interesting fact about The Macallan’s curiously small spirit stills is that they are the smallest in Speyside. They have this unique size and shape to give the spirit maximum surface area contact with the copper.  This, in turn, helps to concentrate on the ‘new make’ spirit.  It will provide the viscosity and rich, fruity, full-bodied flavours so characteristic of The Macallan.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Tain L'Hermitage 1975 - 2003
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1975 this is the very much sought after Glenmorangie 1975 Tain L'Hermitage that has been matured for around 28 years. 
Bottled in 2003 after spending four of these years were spent finishing in casks which previously held Côtes du Rhône wine.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This is the 2019 edition of Macallan's 25 Year Old Sherry Oak. It comes with a stunning wooden presentation box.  It's matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry oak casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This is the 2019 edition of Macallan's 25 Year Old Sherry Oak. It comes with a stunning wooden presentation box.  It's matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry oak casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 40 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This luxurious 40-Year-Old single malt comes in a stunning presentation box.  It was has matured for 40 years in 'Turney casks' 'found' in the warehouse by the master blender.  These long-aged whiskies were vatted to create this rich, deep and complex dram.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition (3x70cl)
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

NAME: Scapa - 25 Year Old 1980
DESCRIPTION:
Most recently reopened in 2004 after quite a colourful history, this old Scpapa would be one of their rarest bottlings and is certainly their oldest official release.
It was distilled in 1980 and bottled in 2005 where only 2000 bottles were produced from a refill bourbon hogshead.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This is the 2019 edition of Macallan's 25 Year Old Sherry Oak. It comes with a stunning wooden presentation box.  It's matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry oak casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 40 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This luxurious 40-Year-Old single malt comes in a stunning presentation box.  It was has matured for 40 years in 'Turney casks' 'found' in the warehouse by the master blender.  These long-aged whiskies were vatted to create this rich, deep and complex dram.

NAME: Brora - 35 Year Old - 2014 Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Brora 35 Year Old was released in 2014 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.  Aged in a combination of refill American and European oak, this has the classic Brora waxiness.
 
Bottle number 1072 out of 2964.

NAME: Glengoyne - 30 Year Old Millennium 2000 AD Grandfather Clock
DESCRIPTION:
Glengoyne Distillery is rare distillery that has been continuously in operation since its founding in 1833 at Dumgoyne.
Unique in character and production, this Highland single malt whisky is matured in the Lowlands but ocated upon the Highland Line. For the non peat lovers among us, Glengoyne does not use peat smoke to dry their barley, but instead uses warm air.
This is a rare and collectable bottling which was to celebrate the milenium using only their finest casks. The youngest whisky in this expression is 30 Years old and there was only 2000 bottles produced.  
This bottling comes with a very unique Grandfather clock.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

NAME: Armagnac - Baron de Sigognac 1945
DESCRIPTION:
Armagnac has been on the go since 1411, it was used a medicine in past times and is is the oldest spirit in the world.
Baron de Sigognac 1945 Vintage Armagnac is available in strictly limited quantities.

NAME: Ardbeg - 2003 Single Cask #2455 - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask bottling was available exclusively at Ardbegs Fèis Ìle open day. This is one of two released for 2019.  It was distilled in 2003 and bottled from Chenin blanc barrel #4586 in April 2019 at the natural cask strength of 52.8%.  This is one of 231 bottles.
This is bottle number 182.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1980 Kildalton
DESCRIPTION:
This legendary Ardbeg was released in 2004 and is from the times where the Islay distillery was experimenting with lightly and non peated expressions. This took place between 1979 and 1981.
Only 1,300 bottles of Kildalton were every released to the public and as you can see by the price trend below, it is becoming ever more popular among collectors.

NAME: Brora - 32 Year Old - Limited Edition 2011
DESCRIPTION:
The Brora 32 Year Old was released in 2011 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?
This is bottle number 1449 out of 1500.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - Fèis Ìle 2019 -1988 Champagne Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Bunnahabhain released three bottlings for 2019 Feis Ile on Islay. This is by far and away the most spectacular of the three, coming in at 30 years old. It comes with a 1cl tasting mini and in a beautiful leather case. One of the lighter whiskies on Islay, combined with this champagne cask is a recipe for success.
Distilled on 1st December 1988 and bottled on 17th May 2019.
One of only 120 bottles.
This is bottle number 19.

NAME: Bimber - 25th Anniversary  of Tudor House.
DESCRIPTION:
Only 76 bottles of this very limited edition single malt whisky from Bimber distillery has been produced in 2020 for the 25th Anniversary of Tudor House.
It matured in an ex-Pedro Ximenez Sherry Cask #25.
This is bottle number 55.

NAME: Glendronach - 33 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in some very very special Oloroso sherry casks, this Glendronach was given 95 out of 100 in Jim Murrays Whisky Bible.
This, of course, gave it great credibility before it went on to win the GOLD MEDAL at the San Francisco Spirits Competition.

NAME: Macallan - 1977 Vintage - Speymalt G&M
DESCRIPTION: This vintage was distilled in 1977 and bottled in 2000 as part of the Speymalt range by Gordon & Macphail.

NAME: Highland Park - Valhalla Collection
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 4 x 70 cl

NAME: Ardbeg - The Oogling Young Uigeadail Committee Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg distillery, found on the south coast of Islay, has been producing whisky since 1798. The commercial aspect of the distillery began production in 1815 and for most of its history, the whisky was used for blends rather than as a single malt.
In the 1800s Ardbeg was producing 300,000 gallons a year. However, tough times throughout the Scotch Whisky industry followed and the distillery closed for quite sometime. However, Glenmorangie PLC saw the calibre of the distillery and purchased it in 1996. It then was bought over by the French giants LVMH on the 28th of December 2004.
Michael "Mickey" Heads, an Islay originally and he was a former manager at Jura who had worked at Ardbeg years earlier, took over on 12 March 2007 until 2020. The new manager, Colin Gordon is set to take over the helm and drive e the company forward to even greater success.
This is a younger cask strength version of the very popular Uigeadeal. This expression was introduced in 2003 and only 1392 bottles were released.

NAME: Laphroaig - 32 Year Old cask Strength 2015 Release Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released in the year 2015, this beautifully packaged Laphroig 32-year-old comes in a striking wooden presentation box.  It is an Islay gem that is becoming rarer and rarer.
Only a few releases from the distillery have been of an age older than this since its release. 
Awards for Laphroaig include double Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005.
This is the cask strength expression at 46.6% ABV.

NAME: Glenlivet  - 1946 Gordon & MacPhail (1980s)
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1946 at The Glenlivet and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in the 1980's.
Aged George & J.G. Smith's bottlings are highly collectable and this older vintage Glenlivet is among the best of them.

NAME: Old Pulteney - 1973 Gordon & Macphail Private Collection
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This bottling comes from their private collection and was distilled in 1973 and filled into cask 2971 and bottled in June 2003. 
Only 241 bottles were ever produced. 
This is bottle 201.

NAME: Longmorn - 25 Year Old 1955 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in 1955 at the Longmorn distillery in Speyside, this single malt was aged for 25 years prior to being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Scapa - 10, 12, 14 & 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Straight from one of the best distilleries in all of Scotland, never mind the Orkney Islands, this lot is a unique opportunity to capture a great selection of what Scapa has to offer. 
Scapa - 10 Year Old 59.2% 50cl
Scapa - 12 Year Old 40% 70cl
Scapa - 14 Year Old 40% 70cl
Scapa - 25 Year Old 54% 70cl

NAME: Oban - 16 Year Old - Managers Dram 1994 - 200th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
This special edition 16-year-old sherry cask whisky was selected in 1994, the 200th anniversary of the Oban distillery.
It is part of the Manager’s Dram series bottled for the employees of Diageo, as it is now known.
The Manager’s Dram selection process was done by each distillery manager on rotation and was bottled at cask strength. John William chose this cask, it was bottled in 1995 from a refill cask.

NAME: Clynelish - 12 Year Old Ainslie and Heilbron 1970s
DESCRIPTION:
Clynelish 12 year old bottled by Ainslie & Heilbron distillers.
The classic label, used for Edoardo Giaccone in 1973 is widely recognised all around the world.
With Brora reopening in the near future all bottles associated with Clynelish have been rising in value as of late.

NAME: Lagavulin - 12 Year Old White Horse
DESCRIPTION:
A rare Lagavulin 12, bottled by White Horse Distillers bearing the Royal Warrant to Her Majesty the Queen.
White Horse now belonging to Diageo, still have the edge on the more recent core ranges. However, most Lagavulin's drams are hugely reliable.

NAME: Macallan - 15 Year Old (1984)
DESCRIPTION:
This 15 Year Old Macallan is of 1984 vintage, matured on the banks of the River Spey for 15 years.
It showcases Easter Elchies house on the front of the tube, this was originally painted by Sara Middleton.

NAME: Chichibu - Highlander Inn The Dramathon 2011
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 249 bottles that was bottled exclusively for The Highlander Inn in Craigellachie to celebrate the 2020 Dramathon. 
Cask #1441 was filled in 2011 and was a Mizunara Hogshead. It was bottled in 2019. 
The Dramathon is a marathon distance race along the Speyside Way from Glenfarclas distillery to Glenfiddich distillery. The route takes in several distilleries along the route. Depending on the distance you run you can pick up the corresponding miniatures at the end of the race.

NAME: Chichibu - Highlander Inn The Dramathon 2011
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 249 bottles that was bottled exclusively for The Highlander Inn in Craigellachie to celebrate the 2020 Dramathon. 
Cask #1441 was filled in 2011 and was a Mizunara Hogshead. It was bottled in 2019. 
The Dramathon is a marathon distance race along the Speyside Way from Glenfarclas distillery to Glenfiddich distillery. The route takes in several distilleries along the route. Depending on the distance you run you can pick up the corresponding miniatures at the end of the race.

NAME: Brora - 24 Year Old - 1977 Rare Malts
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This Highland single malt from the closed distillery, Brora, is 24 years old and bottled at cask strength (56.1%)
This is bottle number 1004.

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2018
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Lagavulin - 21 Year Old 1991-2012 Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
A rare limited edition natural cask strength bottling limited to only 2772 bottles. It was distilled in 1991 and bottled in 2002. The sherry casks were bottles at 52% ABV. 
Bottle number 1348.

NAME: Bimber - Collection (x 5) & Wine
DESCRIPTION:
Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive & Wine:  An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a 2010 single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.  Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen. Gonzalez Byass Oloroso 2010 sherry: 750ml, 18%. The renowned Gonzalez Byass one of the most celebrated Bodegas across Spain. This Oloroso 2010 is stunning and very popular.  It is said to be short and dry, with notes of almond, plum and figs. Pair with game, cheese and nuts to bring out its natural, fruity undertones.
Bimber - Ex-bourbon - Small Batch #1: One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020. 51.8%
Re-Charred Oak Cask - Small Batch #1:  This Bimber Re-charred oak bottling is from Batch 1 of Bimber small-batch releases. Matured in re-charred, American Oak Casks, this is one of just 5000 bottles produced at 51.9%.
Bimber - Peated Cask - Small Batch #1: One of only 1750 bottles in the Bimber Peated Cask Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Ex-peated Quarter Casks to finish.  The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 30th July 2020. 54.1%.
Bimber - Oloroso Cask - Small Batch #1:  One of only 950 bottles in the Bimber Oloroso Sherry Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Spanish Oloroso Sherry to finish. The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 3rd June 2020. 51.4%.

NAME: Bimber - 1st Release London Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After imigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were avalable internationally.

NAME: Ardbeg - 11 Year Old 1998 Single Cask #2763
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg distillery, found on the south coast of Islay, has been producing whisky since 1798. The commercial aspect of the distillery began production in 1815 and for most of its history, the whisky was used for blends rather than as a single malt.
 In the 1800s Ardbeg was producing 300,000 gallons a year. However, tough times throughout the Scotch Whisky industry followed and the distillery closed for quite sometime. However, Glenmorangie PLC saw the calibre of the distillery and purchased it in 1996. It then was bought over by the French giants LVMH on the 28th of December 2004.
Michael "Mickey" Heads, an Islay originally and he was former manager at Jura who had worked at Ardbeg years earlier, took over on 12 March 2007 until 2020. The new manager, Colin Gordon is set to take over the helm and drive e the company forward to even greater success.
This single cask of Ardbeg was distilled in 1998 and bottled 11 years later on the remember remember the 5th of November. A real cracker, this refill sherry hogshead #2763 yielded 270 bottles.
This bottle is number 107.

NAME: Rosebank  - 1981 Flora & Fauna - Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION: This rare, limited edition 1981 vintage Rosebank from the Flora & Fauna series, was bottled in 1997.  It is one of the select few whiskies in the range to get a cask strength version. This is an individually numbered bottle.

NAME: Scapa - 25 Year Old 1980
DESCRIPTION:
Most recently reopened in 2004 after quite a colourful history, this old Scpapa would be one of their rarest bottlings and is certainly their oldest official release.
It was distilled in 1980 and bottled in 2005 where only 2000 bottles were produced from a refill bourbon hogshead.
This bottle is number 404/2000.

NAME: Macallan - Reflexion
DESCRIPTION:
Would you believe us if we told you that for most of the 20th century, the now world famous Macallan was used as the main ingredient of blended malts....
The 1980's was a real turning point for the brand when they moved their focus onto producing some of the finest malts we sample today. 
Their success saw them build a piece of architectural genius in their new distillery in 2018. Perched on the hillside it blends in beautifully to the surrounding landscape overlooking the famous Easter Elchies House. 
This particular release came to market in 2014 as part of their super-premium range. It is part of the 1824 series and was matured in Spanish and American first-fill sherry 'seasoned' casks.
Minor tarnishing to silver bottle top.

NAME: Macallan - Reflexion
DESCRIPTION:
Would you believe us if we told you that for most of the 20th century, the now world famous Macallan was used as the main ingredient of blended malts....
The 1980's was a real turning point for the brand when they moved their focus onto producing some of the finest malts we sample today. 
Their success saw them build a piece of architectural genius in their new distillery in 2018. Perched on the hillside it blends in beautifully to the surrounding landscape overlooking the famous Easter Elchies House. 
This particular release came to market in 2014 as part of their super-premium range. It is part of the 1824 series and was matured in Spanish and American first-fill sherry 'seasoned' casks.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dragon 1973 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Very rarely seen at auction this 20 Year Old Highland Park comes from Cask #13313 and was bottled by Robertson of Kirkwall.
For those who are not familiar with David Robertson, he built Highland Park in 1798.
The distinctive Dragon that appears on the front label comes from the 12th century carving in Maes Howe tomb on Orkney.

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Caol Ila - 20 Year Old - 150th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 1996 celebrating and commemorating 150 years of Caol Ila, which opened in 1846.
This stunning bottle was only ever given to employees of Diageo.

NAME: Bowmore - 21 Year Old 1973
DESCRIPTION:
Islay’s oldest working distillery, Bowmore was established in 1779 and is now regarded as one of the most popular malts not only on Islay, but in the whole of Scotland. The distillery was acquired by Stanley P. Morrison in 1963, ushering in an era of iconic single malts, including the legendary Black Bowmore, credited by many as the genesis of whisky collecting, bottled in 1993. The distillery was bought under the control Suntory the year after they had been stakeholders since 1989), and it remains one of the most collectible brands in Scotch whisky today. Bowmore is one of the few remaining Scottish distilleries to use its own floor maltings, providing them with 40% of their requirements.
The unique microclimate of the No.1 Vaults warehouse at Bowmore distillery means casks share very little with the angels, and has allowed the distillery to bottle some spectacular age-statements over the years. These early Morrison Bowmore era vintages are considered classics, particualrly this parcel of 1964 vintage sherry casks. Indeed, it is hard to fathom where whisky collecting would be today without the Black Bowmore. 
This 21 year old was distilled in 1973 and is a real collectors item!

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Hibiki - 21 Year Old - Kacho Fugetsu Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Shinjirō Torii started in 1899 as a wine store in Japanese town Osaka and the rest is history for Suntory. They are seen as the founding and leading Japanese influence for Whisky.
Yamazaki was his first venture into the distilling industry and produced grain/malt whisky. After its great success, a second distillery was built and called.....Hakushu. Thank you Mr Torii.
Hibiki is the most popular blend by Suntory which came to the publics lips in 1989 with whiskies from both Yamazaki, Hakushu and the Chita grain whisky. 
This bottling represents the beauty of Japanese nature.

NAME: Macallan - 21 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

NAME: Macallan - 21 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak) x 6
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 1991
DESCRIPTION:
The start of this series began in 1982 and quite possibly the most recognisable malt in the world, The Macallan 18 Year Old. The 18 year old in the tube packaging is one of 6 releases of this kind, depicting Sara Middletons view of the estate on the front.
Distilled in Speyside, within touching distance of Easter Elchies house and fully matured in Sherry oak cask from Jerez, Spain.
This malt was distilled in 1991. 'Best malt in the world' Whisky Magazine, June 2004.

NAME: Daftmill - 2006 Winter - Berry Bro & Rudd - #39
DESCRIPTION:
Well...where do you start with this exceptional lot and opportunity to own some of the hardest to find Daftmills.
Daftmill - A family (The Cuthbert's) owned and operated seasonal distillery located in Fife. Granted a license on St Andrews Day 2005, first distillation took place in December 2005.
Winter 2006 - The third release and a limited edition Winter batch release which was distilled shortly after opening in 2006.  It is one of only 1,625 bottles and is made up of whisky from 6 first fill Bourbon barrels. 46% ABV
Berry Bro's & Rudd -  Bottled exclusively for Berry Bros & Rudd in 2019 this lowland whisky is quite possibly their most sought after expression yet with only 621 bottles produced. 57.4% ABV.

NAME: Rosebank - 21 Years old 1990
DESCRIPTION:
From the Special Release range comes this Rosebank, distilled in  1990 at Cask Strength for 21 years.
Bottled in 2011 only 5886 bottles were produced.
As you can see by our price trends...this bottle is becoming more and more valuable over time.
Bottle 3785.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 19 Year Old 1989 Black Art 1st Edition
DESCRIPTION: A highly regarded single malt aged for 19 years on the beautiful island of Islay. This Black Art is the first in a spectacular series from Jim McEwan of Bruichladdich. There was 6000 bottles produced and they are becoming highly sought after.

NAME: Caol Ila - 20 Year Old - 150th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 1996 celebrating and commemorating 150 years of Caol Ila, which opened in 1846.
This stunning bottle was only ever given to employees of Diageo.

NAME: Ardbeg - 2007 Single Cask #5824
DESCRIPTION:
This 2007 vintage single cask is very special and very hard to come by with only 245 bottles being produced from a single First Fill Bourbon Barrel.
This single butt #5824 was bottled on the 12th June 2019.
This is bottle number 42.

NAME: Chichibu - 2012 Ichiro's Malt Single cask #1700 Sweden
DESCRIPTION:
From the very in fashion and the highly acclaimed Chichibu distillery, this release was exclusive for Sweden. 268 bottles were produced at cask strength after being distilled back in 2012. 
Cask #1700 was a new American white oak cask.

NAME: Gautier Freres - 1937 Vintage
DESCRIPTION:
Gautier managed to secure the Royal warrant in order to produce Cognac in 1755 as seen on the label - "Maison Fondée en 1755".
This family-owned business made world-renowned cognac for years before being bought over by the Belvedere group.
This bottling was specially selected for Seager Evans & Co. Ltd.

NAME: Daftmill - 2006 Single Cask #077 - Europe
DESCRIPTION:
This first fill Bourbon barrel 077/2006 was filled on 16th December 2006 and is sister cask to the Winter batch release. This bottled exclusively for Eurpoe. Only 213 bottles were produced.  
This is bottle number 125.

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Macallan - Reflexion
DESCRIPTION:
Would you believe us if we told you that for most of the 20th century, the now world famous Macallan was used as the main ingredient of blended malts....
The 1980's was a real turning point for the brand when they moved their focus onto producing some of the finest malts we sample today. 
Their success saw them build a piece of architectural genius in their new distillery in 2018. Perched on the hillside it blends in beautifully to the surrounding landscape overlooking the famous Easter Elchies House. 
This particular release came to market in 2014 as part of their super-premium range. It is part of the 1824 series and was matured in Spanish and American first-fill sherry 'seasoned' casks.

NAME: Ardbeg - 2011 Single Cask #2198
DESCRIPTION:
This is a collectable bottling from Ardbeg.  It was distilled in August 2011 and was matured in a 1st fill bourbon barrel until July 2018. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 60.2% ABV. This is one of just 256 individually numbered bottles produced from cask number 2198.
Bottle number 29.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Laphroaig - 21 Year Old (1998) - The Whisky Exchange
DESCRIPTION: A 1998 Laphroaig single malt bottled in 2019 by The Whisky Exchange. Matured for 21 years and finished since 2010 in a single oloroso sherry cask 117.  This is one of 322 bottles.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Re-awakening
DESCRIPTION:
A Limited edition, released to celebrate of the reopening of Macallan's second still house, which had been closed for over 20 years.
This is one of 1002 bottles individually numbered bottles, which were exclusively available from the distillery.
This is bottle number 779.

NAME: Daftmill - 2006 - Single Cask #044/2006 - (Royal Mile Whiskies)
DESCRIPTION:
Single Cask of Daftmill bottled exclusively for Royal Mile Whiskies. This single cask whisky comes from cask #44, a first-fill American Oak bourbon hogshead from Heaven Hill distillery, which was filled with Daftmill spirit on July 31st 2006 and bottled in May this year at a cask strength of 56% ABV.
The cask yielded just 231 bottles. This expression has been bottled for Royal Mile Whiskies. Daftmill is a farm distillery. Owned and operated by the Cuthbert family, it only runs in the farm's quiet periods; midsummer and winter, sometimes producing as few as 100 casks per year.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing the malting barley used to make this lowland whisky. This single cask is a perfect representation of the Daftmill style and was voted for democratically by the Royal Mile Whiskies tasting team. Such a thorough investigation of the warehouses was only made possible with Mr Cuthbert's generosity and patience, as well as Mrs Cuthbert's delicious baking. 
This is bottle number 137.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

DESCRIPTION:

The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
