The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Balvenie - 21 Year Old Madeira Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION: This was a travel retail release in 2016 from the Speyside distillery, Balvenie. The Maderia cask finish was matured for 20 years in traditional oak casks before being transferred into casks that matured fortified Maderia wine.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #5875 - Vinothek Massen Luxembourg
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Vinothek Massen Luxembourg.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in Refill Butt #5875 and bottled at a cask strength of 65.4% ABV.  With only 619 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Craigellachie - 2005 (Clan Denny)
DESCRIPTION: A Craigellachie single malt bottled by Douglas McGibbon's for their Clan Denny range.  Distilled in October 2005 and bottled in February 2018.  Matured in sherry butt #12422.

NAME: Dailuaine - 2005 (Clan Denny)
DESCRIPTION:
A Dailuaine single malt bottled by Douglas McGibbon's for their Clan Denny range.  Distilled in April 2005, matured in sherry butt #12426 and bottled in February 2018 at the natural cask strength of 59.6%. This is one of 643 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 309.

NAME: Highland Park - 21 Year Old August 2019 Release
DESCRIPTION: 21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets. Released in October 2019, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

NAME: Dailuaine - 2008 (Clan Denny)
DESCRIPTION: A Dailuaine single malt bottled by Douglas McGibbon's for their Clan Denny range.  Distilled in January 2008, matured in sherry butt #12590 and bottled in July 2018 at the natural cask strength of 57.5%. This is one of 687 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #3294 - K & L wine Merchants 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled hand-selected by K & L Wine Merchants.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill hogshead #3294 and bottled at the cask strength of 64.5% ABV.  With only 253 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

NAME: Royal Lochnagar - Selected Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
Royal Lochnagar Select Reserve is presented in a wooden case that is lined with a royal blue colour.
Royal Lochnagar Distillery is one of the three distilleries in Scotland ever to be granted the title of 'Royal' in front of their name.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - Hand Fills (4 x 20cl)
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 4 superb Bunnahabhain 20cl Hand Fills including:

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Daftmill - 2007 Winter Batch 2020 (EU Release)
DESCRIPTION:
A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1690 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 047/2007, 048/2007, 049/2007, 051/2007, 051/2007, 052/2007 and 053/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2020.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

NAME: Box - The Festival 2014
DESCRIPTION: The Box Whisky The Festival 2014 was matured largely in American oak casks. The American oak was air-dried for 24 months and roasted medium-plus before charring. A rather unique combination that resulted in a deeper and sweeter spice than you normally get from charred American oak.

NAME: Ben Nevis - 22 Year Old (1996) - Whisky Show - TWE 20th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION: Released for The Whisky Exchange at Whisky Show 2019 as part of the Magic of the Cask series & their 20th-anniversary celebrations. The label design revels when a UV light is shined on it! This 1996 Ben Nevis single malt spent 22 years in a single refill sherry butt, before being bottled in 2019.

NAME: Macallan - Enigma
DESCRIPTION: Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

NAME: Scapa - 23 Year Old Single Cask Edition #1069
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask series comes from the Chivas Brothers, was bottled on the 28th of July in 2015. Matured in cask 1069 for 23 years this cask produced 780 bottles.
All of the Chivas distillery single cask editions were made available from their respective distillery shop. This, of course, is quite rare a rare bottling and made even more so for this fact. Grab it now while you can.  
Bottle 711.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Ardbeg - Perpetuum - Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Highland Park - Shiel - Keystone 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 2nd release, from Highland Park, Shiel.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The shovels, made of wood, that are used to turn the barley is where the name Shiel originates.
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

NAME: Glenfiddich - 23 Year Old Grand Cru
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenfiddich range has a new member, Grand Cru.
'The ultimate spirit of celebration' was released on general sale at the distillery in 2019 and has been matured for 23 years in American and European oak casks.
The finishing touch is the expression being finished in French cuvée casks.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old Still Young 1998-2008 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Still Young was released in 2008. 
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’ of which this is the second release.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

NAME: Caol Ila - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This version of the Caol Ila 25 year old was introduced in 2010, after cask strength versions in 2004 and 2005.  It was the first officially-bottled Caol Ila 25yo to be bottled at 43%.

NAME: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Sherry Cask - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION: This is one of just 3000 bottles in this release by Bowmore which was sold exclusively at the distillery, during Fèis Ìle 2018.  This single malt has been matured exclusively in first-fill Oloroso sherry casks for 15 years.  It was bottled at the cask strength of 52.5% ABV.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Caroni - The Duchess 21 Year Old 1998
DESCRIPTION:
Caroni was established in 1918 and can be found in the centre of Trinidad's Caroni plains. It is a single estate distillery and possesses its own sugar plant. In the very early days they used a cast iron pot still, which in later years was replaced with a single column style still. Caroni became famous for its very distinctive heavy style of rum.
 A year after the distillery closed in 2004 Italian raconteur Luca Gargano headed to Trinidad and came across the derelict distillery. On a photoshoot he stumbled across a warehouse full of Caroni barrels and in the next few years the barrels were purchased.
The distillery is now closed, however this bottle is still in high demand. It came from single cask #20 and was distilled in 1998. It is one of only 245 bottles. 
The Duchess is an Indy bottler from Europe.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2019 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2019 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 16 Year Old Cuvee C Margaux​
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich 16 year old, matured in bourbon casks initially before being transferred into first growth wine barrels from Chateau LaFleur. This is highly respected vineyard across the world.
Bruichladdich's did a series named "First Growth" which all were finished in Bordeaux wine casks.
This is the 3rd release in the series and is limited to 12000 bottles.
This is bottle number 4909 of 12000.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2015
DESCRIPTION: A special release for the Lagavulin 2015 Jazz Festival. This bottling is a vatting of refill American Oak Casks and European Oak Bodega Casks.  This was a limited edition release of individually numbered bottles bottled at the cask strength of 55.4%.

NAME: Cardhu - 12 Year Old 1970's
DESCRIPTION:
An early bottling of this Speyside malt. It is a key ingredient for the Johnnie Walker blend.
Becoming even rarer this older style bottle has since been replaced with a more dumpy bottle.

NAME: Glendronach - 13 Year Old - 2003 Single Oloroso Cask #5490
DESCRIPTION:
A 13-year-old single cask Oloroso Sherry butt matured Glendronach.
Distilled in 01/08/2003 and bottled 08/2016 from cask #5490. 
This is one of only 660 bottles.
 
Bottle number 196.

NAME: Glen Garioch - 21 Year Old - 1997 Single Cask Release - Aberdeen Airpot & World of Whiskies Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
This Glen Garioch 21 year old single cask release was distilled in 1997 in a 1st fill bourbon barrel before being bottled on the 3rd of May 2019 from cask #91. There is only 188 bottles.
This is an exclusive bottling for Aberdeen International Airport and World of Whiskies Exclusive.
 
This is bottle number 98.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #3294 - K & L wine Merchants 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled hand-selected by K & L Wine Merchants.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill hogshead #3294 at the cask strength of 64.5% ABV.  With only 253 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 21 Year Old August 2019 Release
DESCRIPTION: 21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets. Released in October 2019, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

NAME: Chivas - 21 Year Old -  Royal Salute - Snow Polo Edition (70cl & 5cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes a 70cl & a 5cl bottling: 
The Snow Polo Edition is the 3rd in the series and draws inspiration from the grandeur and style of the sport. The tournament is a spectacle of breath-taking scenes, from the landscape of majestic snow-capped mountain to the sophisticated surroundings. 
A fitting tribute to the purity of the snow, graceful spirit of the game and elegance of the backdrop, Roya Salute's Snow Polo Edition is the result of 21 years maturation in high-quality oak casks.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 18 Year Old - Hand Filled (Culag)
DESCRIPTION:
This Distillery Exclusive handful was drawn from a 'Culag' cask.  The single malt has been matured for 18 years, including a finish in a Cognac cask.
It was bottled by hand on the 24th of May 2019. This is one of only 190 bottles.
 
Bottle number 02.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1998 Renaissance
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Renaissance is the end of the 4 part series that began with the 'Very Young.' 
Renaissance is the first 10-year old Ardbeg that is entirely comprised of spirit produced after Glenmorangie's takeover of the distillery in 1997. Bottled in 2008, this 
A fitting end to the series.

NAME: Highland Park - 21 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: 21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets, this whisky was named Best Single Malt of the Year at the World Whisky Awards 2009. Released in October 2007, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2004 Moine Marsala
DESCRIPTION:
This 2004 vintage single malt from Bunnahabhain is extremely limited and is one of just 564 bottles produced. 
It was bottled in June 2017 and before this, it was matured in a Sicilian Marsala wine cask for 4 years.
 
This is bottle number 242.

NAME: Dalmore - 1992 Special Cask Finish - Black Pearl Malmasey Maderia Cask
DESCRIPTION: This single cask Dalmore was distilled in 1992. This expression was matured in Malmasey Maderia Casks for 12 years.

NAME: Ardbeg - Alligator - 5cl Mini (Leather Case)
DESCRIPTION:
An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series Germany #5886
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Matured in 1st fill European Sherry Butt and bottled in 2016.
Distilled in 2003 this released was limited to 630 bottles exclusively produced for GERMANY.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove 2016
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Singleton Of Glen Ord - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram 2016
DESCRIPTION: A 16-year-old Single malt from Glen Ord, specially selected by malt distillery managers within Diageo Distillery Ltd and bottled at natural cask strength. This is the 2016 Edition.

NAME: Macallan - Enigma
DESCRIPTION: Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.

NAME: Glengoyne - 15 Year Old​ 1991 - Jim's Choice
DESCRIPTION:
One of the nine bottles from the Glengoyne “Choice” series. American Oak Sherry Butt #1083 was chosen by Glengoyne Mashman Jim Leslie.  Distilled on the 1st of August 199, matured for 15 years and bottled in August 2006 by Lang Brothers.  This is one of only 693 bottles filled from the single sherry cask.

This is bottle number 230.

NAME: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - Ice
DESCRIPTION:
Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

NAME: Elijah Craig - 18 Year Old - Single Barrel
DESCRIPTION: The name Elijah Craig adorns some of Heaven Hill Brands’ finest bourbons.  This is an 18 Year Old Straight Kentucky small-batch bourbon, the barrels are hand-selected by the Master Distiller Parker Beam.

NAME: Ardbeg - Kelpie - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

NAME: Scapa - 17 Year Old Cask Strength SC 17 004 50cl
DESCRIPTION:
From the Chivas Brothers this Scapa 17-year-old was bottled at cask strength in 2011. 
It was distilled in 1993 and presented in their older style packing it is simply lovely. The batch number reads SC 17 004.

NAME: Glenlivet - Cipher
DESCRIPTION: A limited-edition single malt whisky from The Glenlivet's Master Distiller, Alan Winchester.  The Glenlivet Cipher comes in an opaque black bottle without cask information, tasting notes and age statement.  This bottle is surrounded by mystery.  You are encouraged to find the secret flavour hidden on the bottle label and visit the Cipher website for full tasting notes.

NAME: Macallan - Lumina
DESCRIPTION: Lumina is part of The Macallan Quest range which was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It features four no-age statement expressions showing off the many, many miles travelled to sources the casks to mature the Speyside whisky. The Lumina expression is made with whisky aged in sherry-seasoned European and American oak casks, as well as hogsheads. While sherry does get a good look-in with this one, it's a much more vanilla and toffee-focussed dram.

NAME: Port Charlotte - PC 8 Ar Duthchas
DESCRIPTION:
Port Charlotte PC8, produced by Bruichladdich Distillery, is a heavily peated spirit.  It was the first release of heavily peated Port Charlotte and was produced in 2009 from some of the first spirits to be produced after the distillery's reopening.  The single malt was bottled at 8 years old in 2006 and was limited to 30000 bottles.
This malt is very much about the sentimental value in remembrance for the lost distillery at Port Charlotte on Islay. It closed in 1929. 
This is bottle number 780.

NAME: Macallan - Terra (Quest Collection)
DESCRIPTION: 'Terra' single malt whisky from Macallan’s Quest Collection, is a complex whisky with a distinctive flavour of toffee, dried fruits and rich, woody spices. Aged exclusively in first-fill European and American oak sherry seasoned casks, Terra has a golden amber colour, and aromas of dried fruits, lemon and toffee.

NAME: Ardbeg - Drum - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.

NAME: Bowmore - Devil's Cask - Batch III - Double the Devil
DESCRIPTION: The third and final appearance of The Devil's Casks from Bowmore.  Deemed ' Double the Devil' Batch 3 combines the features of the previous two releases. Matured in both Pedro Ximénez and oloroso sherry casks.

NAME: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.3 2020 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2020 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.
This expression was aged in three different casks:
Sherry Hogshead, French Puncheon & Bourbon Barrel.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Dewar's - White Label 150th Anniversary - Limited edition
DESCRIPTION: In celebration of John Dewar setting up his own wine and spirits company in Perth 1846 this limited edition bottle was released in 1996.

NAME: Glamis Castle - 25 Year Old - Royal Crystal Decanter
DESCRIPTION:
A Royal Brierley full lead crystal decanter specially blended 25 year old whisky which was released in 1990.  It was commissioned by Glamis Castle to Commemorate the 90th Birthday of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother.  It is presented in an elegant crystal decanter and comes with a silk lined presentation box.
This is bottle number 0458.

NAME: Macallan - Gold (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.
This is a limited edition bottling.

NAME: Macallan - 26 Year Old Miniature 5cl 1966
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in sherry wood for 26 years comes this 5cl miniature of Macallan.
Regularly setting records at auctions, The Macallan minis are one of the most sought after in the world.
This is bottle number 1890.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2019 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2019 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001: 'The Last of the First' - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Heretic, 2001 has been named 'The Last of the First' as the limited release of 1300 bottles was from the last five casks from Port Charlotte’s first year of distillation in 2001. Adam Hannett, Head Distiller carefully married these five casks which previously held either American whiskey, rum or fine French wine. 
This was a limited edition, Feis Ile 2018, Distillery exclusive release from Bruichladdich Distillery.

NAME: Daftmill - 2008 Summer Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

NAME: Matsui ​Kurayoshi - 18 Year Old Pure Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Japanese whisky or blended whisky...everything about this bottle points to that. However, the early releases are imported malt from Scotland that has been aged in Japan. 
Kurayoshi distillery is producing its own whisky now.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - Moine Oloroso
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Bunnahabhain distillery was fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks, revealing a side of the distillery not often seen. It has been bottled at the cask strength of 60.1 % ABV.

NAME: The Lakes - Whiskymaker's Reserve No.2
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is No 2. from The Lakes Whiskymaker Reserve cask strength release, matured in the finest sourced Px, red wine cask and bourbon casks.
Bottled at cask strength 60.9% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg - Ardbog 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2013 for Ardbeg Day during Fèis Ìsle, Ardbog is a 10-Year-Old single malt by Ardbeg.  It is made from a vatting of whisky matured in a combination of bourbon casks and manzanilla casks, creating a balanced soft, sweet and earthy flavour.  In the World Whiskies Awards 2014, Ardbog won Best Islay Whisky NAS.
This is a 5cl bottling.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old cask #5424 Duty Zero Hong Kong
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Distilled in 2004 and bottled in 2018 from refill butt #5424. It has been bottled exclusively for Duty Zero in Hong Kong.

NAME: Arran - 21 Year Old Explorer Series Kildonan & Pladda Island Volume III
DESCRIPTION:
The isle of Arran is known for great whisky and equally stunning views. The explorers series are all limited editions of which this is the third release. Each release pays tribute to the stunning views that can be absorbed when visiting the island. 
Only 9000 bottles of the Kildonan & Pladda Island have been released. The dram within was matured in sherry butts and puncheons before being finished in Ruby Port casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6046 - Empire State 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and is the Empire State Release.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill sherry butt #6046 at the cask strength of 65.8% ABV.  With only 593 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Ardbeg - 12 Year Old - Serendipity
DESCRIPTION: Born out of a happy accident when someone mistakenly mixed some Glen Moray into a vat of old Ardbeg. The mix-up created this blend that is 2 parts Glen Moray and 8 parts of older Ardbeg.  Serendipity is a lightly smoky blended malt. A rare find with a charming story.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6046 - Empire State 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and is the Empire State Release.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill sherry butt #6046 and bottled at the cask strength of 65.8% ABV.  With only 593 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Traditional 100 Proof
DESCRIPTION:
Glenmorangie Traditional is 100 Proof which equates to 57.2% BAV.
A limited edition, this expression was matured for 10 years in mountain oak until being bottled at its natural strength.
Before 1700 the farmers of Ross-shire originally supplied malt whisky to the royal burgh of Tain, the home of Glenmorangie.
Aromas: Cloves, cinnamon, vanilla. honey and citrus fruits.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #1932 - Copenhagen Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Copenhagen Airport.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in refill butt #1932 at was bottled at the cask strength of 59.7% ABV in 2018.  With only 300 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition. This is one of 585 bottles

NAME: Macallan - Amber
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex.

NAME: Singleton Of Glen Ord - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram 2016
DESCRIPTION: A 16-year-old Single malt from Glen Ord, specially selected by malt distillery managers within Diageo Distillery Ltd and bottled at natural cask strength. This is the 2016 Edition.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

NAME: Glenburgie - 25 Year Old 1992 Old Particular
DESCRIPTION: Only 270 bottles of this single malt scotch whisky have been produced from the Glen Burgie distillery. Distilled in April 1992 this cask strength expression was aged for 25 years before being bottled by the family-owned firm Douglas Laing for their Old Particular Label.

NAME: Macallan - Enigma
DESCRIPTION: Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Pre Royal Warrant 37.5cl
DESCRIPTION: These are a special bottling of Laphroaig 10-year-old that were around before Laphroaig was granted the Royal Warrant.  Every bottle since has featured the Coat of Arms of HRH.  This is a 37.5cl bottling.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Caol Ila - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna Boxed
DESCRIPTION:
By far one of the most sought after Flora and Fauna bottlings.
This Caol Ila 15 year old has been discontinued for some time now and this is starting to show in the value of the bottle increasing over time.
Caol Ila is, of course, the only Islay bottle in the collection which helps add to how rare it is.

NAME: Ardbeg - Ardbog
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2013 for Ardbeg Day during Fèis Ìsle, Ardbog is a 10-Year-Old single malt by Ardbeg.  It is made from a vatting of whisky matured in a combination of bourbon casks and manzanilla casks, creating a balanced soft, sweet and earthy flavour.  In the World Whiskies Awards 2014, Ardbog won Best Islay Whisky NAS.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old Still Young 1998-2008 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Still Young was released in 2008. 
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’ of which this is the second release.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old #385 2001 Dalecarlia
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Distilled in 2001 and matured for 16 years before being bottled in 2017. This is a single cask #385 and bottled for Dalecarlia. Matured in a European Oak Sherry Butt.

NAME: North Star Spirits  - Sirius - 31 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This Blended Malt Whisky has been matured in first fill Bourbon barrels for 31 years. Named after the brightest star in the night sky, Sirius is a waxy and citrusy spirit which can only be found in the finest Highland distilleries.

NAME: Balvenie - 21 Year Old - Port Wood
DESCRIPTION:
Balvenie 21 Year Old Port Wood certainly holds its own in the core range. 
It lives up to its name having an additional period of maturation in 30 year-old port pipes.
Signed by David Stewart.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask Series - Helvetia 2nd Swiss Edition #6148
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 15 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Matured in a first fill European Oak Sherry Butt and bottled in 2018.
Distilled in 2003 this release was limited to 611 bottles for Helvetia 2nd Swiss Edition.

NAME: Daftmill - 2008 Summer Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

NAME: Littlemill - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A 12 year old official bottling from this lost Lowand distillery Littlemill.  This is a rare bottling that is becoming increasingly hard to find.

NAME: Arran - White Stag - Fourth Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the fourth release in the Arran Distillery White Stag series.  It was released exclusively to Arran's online community, the White Stag.  
This small batch bottling from 4 ex-bourbon barrels was specially selected by a tasting panel of 20 members of the White Stag.

NAME: Bowmore - Feis Ile 2016 - Virgin Oak & Oloroso Sherry
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle was released during Feis Ile 2016. 
It is made with a marriage of four American virgin oak barrels and a 1st fill Oloroso sherry butt. After being married together the spirit was returned to the original casks for a longer period of maturation.  Bottled at a cask strength of 54.9% and limited to only 1500 bottles. 
This is bottle number 345.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2017
DESCRIPTION:
This was Lagavulin’s 2017 Fèis Ìle bottling. It is a 16-year old Islay, Moscatel Cask Wood double matured, limited to 6000 individually numbered bottles.  Bottled in 2017 at natural cask strength for the annual Islay whisky festival in May.
This is bottle number 571.

NAME: Dufftown - 20 Year Old Centenary Bottling
DESCRIPTION:
Built in 1896, Dufftown produced this dram to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the distillery.
It was bottled in 1996 at cask strength after having matured for 20 years.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The 2017 Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival expression was matured in a combination of refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.  It’s described as a sweet and typically peaty expression, with ‘hints of almonds, brazil nuts, pears and smoked ham’.
This is a limited edition release of just 6000 individually numbered bottles.

NAME: Cragganmore - 15 Year Old 150th Anniversary Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A Cragganmore distillery exclusive bottling to commemorate their 150th anniversary, which was in 2019. It is one of 1869 bottles, which, I don't think is a coincidence matches the year of the distillery's foundation.
This single malt has been double matured in American oak for 15 years.

NAME: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.3 2020 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2020 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.
This expression was aged in three different casks:
Sherry Hogshead, French Puncheon & Bourbon Barrel.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 16 year Old Heavily Peated Feis 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This super heavily peated malt is the oldest release in the series. It was distilled in 2003 and Bruoichladdich used only Scottish barely. Only 3000 bottles were produced at 55.8% Abv. 
Casks used -
Refill Hogshead - Then recasked to bourbon barrels in 2012.
Firstfill Bourbon Barrels - Then recasked into ex-Sauternes casks in 2013.
Ex Sherry / Ex Bourbon and Virgin Oak.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The 2017 Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival expression was matured in a combination of refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.  It’s described as a sweet and typically peaty expression, with ‘hints of almonds, brazil nuts, pears and smoked ham’.
This is a limited edition release of just 6000 individually numbered bottles.
Bottle 1444.

NAME: Daftmill - 2008 Summer Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

NAME: Mortlach - 25 Year Old  Gordon & Macphail Distillery Labels
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Part of their distillery labels collection, this well aged Mortlach is a must-try. the range is testimony to the long-standing relationship that G&M have with the distilleries.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 950 bottles in the Bimber Oloroso Sherry Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Spanish Oloroso Sherry to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 3rd June 2020.
 
This is bottle number 935.

NAME: Glendronach - 12 Year Old Sherry Casks 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
A beautiful sherry cask from Glendronach aged 12 years.
This bottle is dated in the 1980s.
Very rare and becoming a great bottle for collectors.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No4 - 2018 - Edrington & Maxxium Staff
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan Distillery.

NAME: Daftmill - 2008 Summer Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

NAME: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.3 2020 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2020 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.
This expression was aged in three different casks:
Sherry Hogshead, French Puncheon & Bourbon Barrel.

NAME: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.3 2020 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2020 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.
This expression was aged in three different casks:
Sherry Hogshead, French Puncheon & Bourbon Barrel.

NAME: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.3 2020 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2020 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.
This expression was aged in three different casks:
Sherry Hogshead, French Puncheon & Bourbon Barrel.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #5187 - Riptide (75cl)
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Riptide (USA).  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in first-fill European Oak Sherry Puncheon at the cask strength of 65.5% ABV.  With only 568 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: Arran - 21 Year Old Explorer Series Kildonan & Pladda Island Volume III
DESCRIPTION:
The isle of Arran is known for great whisky and equally stunning views. The explorers series are all limited editions of which this is the third release. Each release pays tribute to the stunning views that can be absorbed when visiting the island. 
Only 9000 bottles of the Kildonan & Pladda Island have been released. The dram within was matured in sherry butts and puncheons before being finished in Ruby Port casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old #385 2001 Dalecarlia
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Distilled in 2001 and matured for 16 years before being bottled in 2017. This is a single cask #385 and bottled for Dalecarlia. Matured in a European Oak Sherry Butt.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2017
DESCRIPTION:
This was Lagavulin’s 2017 Fèis Ìle bottling. It is a 16-year old Islay, Moscatel Cask Wood double matured, limited to 6000 individually numbered bottles.  Bottled in 2017 at natural cask strength for the annual Islay whisky festival in May.
This is bottle number 3.

NAME: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - The Dark
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2017, 'The Dark' is first in the Highland Park series that celebrates the seasons on the Isle of Orkney, where Highland Park is made. The Dark is a 17-year-old single malt that has been matured in sherry casks, giving it aromas of dried fruits, nuts and herbs combined with smoky peat to as a nod to the autumn and winter seasons of Orkney.  The Light followed in 2018 symbolising spring and summer. 
The Dark is a limited release 28,000.

NAME: Cragganmore - 15 Year Old 150th Anniversary Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A Cragganmore distillery exclusive bottling to commemorate their 150th anniversary, which was in 2019. It is one of 1869 bottles, which, I don't think is a coincidence matches the year of the distillery's foundation.
This single malt has been double matured in American oak for 15 years.

NAME: Highland Park - 21 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: 21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets, this whisky was named Best Single Malt of the Year at the World Whisky Awards 2009. Released in October 2007, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

NAME: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.3 2020 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2020 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.
This expression was aged in three different casks:
Sherry Hogshead, French Puncheon & Bourbon Barrel.

NAME: Tamnavulin - 28 Year Old - Stillman's Dram
DESCRIPTION: A 28-year-old Tamnavulin released as part of Whyte & Mackay's now-discontinued Stillman's Dram series.

NAME: Mortlach - 20 Year Old Cowies Blue Seal 2.81
DESCRIPTION:
Would you believe us if we said this single malt from the BEAST of Dufftown has been distilled 2.81 times...well you better!! This dram takes its inspiration from the world-renowned and award-winning 1992 release!
Mortlach utilises a complex distillation process unlike any other. Three Wash Stills and three spirit stills are all unique in shape, size and have been hand cut. 
They believe that for 70 years, Mortlach has been the best kept secret in Scotch whisky. 
This was exclusive to the travel retail range.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #6159 - Bulgaria 681
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was hand-selected and bottled exclusively for Bulgaria 681.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in first-fill European hogshead #6159 at the cask strength of 58.4% ABV.  With only 554 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 18 Year Old (2000s)
DESCRIPTION: This 18-year-old Highland Park is an old presentation from the early 2000s. The dumpy style bottle was used from 1999 until Highland Park was redesigned in the mid-2000s.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 14 Years Old 2005 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A suspended summer release of a 14-year-old distillery exclusive that has been bottled for The Spirit of Speyside 2020. It was distilled in 2005 and matured in an Oloroso Sherry butt before being bottled at cask strength 58.2% .
Cask #2855 yielded 650 bottles and also comes with the distinctive Glenfarclas wooden case.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old Pedro Ximénez Limted Edition
DESCRIPTION:
A limited-edition bottling from the Bunnahabhain distillery on the north-east coast of Islay. This is a 11 year old single malt was aged in a Pedro Ximenez cask.
This is one of individually numbered 833 bottles.  
Bottle number 2.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Teaninich - 17 Year Old (2001) - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
A rare Teaninich, released as part of the Manager's Dram series. The bottles were released exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength. 
This release was bottled in September 2001 at 58.3%.  It is a 17 year old single malt from refill casks.  
 
This is bottle 1401.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3249 - Nor'Easter 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Northeast United States - Nor'Easter.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #3249 at the cask strength of 56.9% ABV.  With only 546 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Daftmill - 2008 Summer Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2016 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn from refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.
This is bottle number 6.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #6551 - San Diego
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for San Diego.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 12 years in First Fill European Sherry Oak Butt #6551 and bottled at the cask strength of 65.6% ABV.  With only 294 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Chivas Regal - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This Chivas Regal 25 year old is a delicious blend, with notes of peach and almond. It comes in a striking presentation box.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The 2017 Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival expression was matured in a combination of refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.  It’s described as a sweet and typically peaty expression, with ‘hints of almonds, brazil nuts, pears and smoked ham’.
This is a limited edition release of just 6000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 199.

NAME: Scapa - 20 Year Old Cask Strength SC 20 007
DESCRIPTION:
From the Chivas Brothers this Scapa 20-year-old was bottled at cask strength in 2013. 
It was distilled in 1993 and presented in their older style packing it is simply lovely. The batch number reads SC 20 007.
It is said to have round flavours of peaches and candy. What's not to love about that?

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #3030 - Daner (70cl)
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Daner which was edition 4 in the Founders Series.  Distilled in 2006, this single malt was matured for 12 years in 1st fill European Oak Sherry Butt, then bottled at the cask strength of 63.3% ABV.  With only 623 bottles available.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3233 - Florida
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively as the Florida Edition.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill sherry butt #3233 at the cask strength of 57.8% ABV.  With only 584 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 18 Year Old Single Cask #2865 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 18 years in American Oak Butt #2865..
606 bottles were produced from this cask.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 14 Year Old 2005 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A suspended summer release of a 14-year-old distillery exclusive that had been bottled for The Spirit of Speyside 2020. It was distilled in 2005 and matured in an Oloroso Sherry butt before being bottled at cask strength 58.2% .
Cask #2855 yielded 650 bottles and also comes with the distinctive Glenfarclas wooden case.
This is bottle number 213.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Signet
DESCRIPTION:
A mix of both you malts 'chocolate malt'  and much older expressions, some said to be well over 30 years. 
Said to have a complex finish with a hint of bittersweet orange. A real contrast between richness and depth.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition, 2018 bottling was released to celebrate The  2018 Islay Jazz Festival.  The single malt was matured in hand selected first fill American Oak & refill Hogsheads and Puncheons before being bottled at a natural cask strength of 58.5%. Each bottle is individually numbered.
This is bottle number 3322.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Bowmore - 11 Year Old (Sherry) - Fèis Ìle 2017
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 2017 Fèis Ìle Festival bottling from Bowmore Distillery. It has been matured for 11 years in Oloroso sherry and Bordeaux wine casks. It was bottled at cask strength.  This is a limited release of only 2000 bottles.   
This is bottle number 0097.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - Old Harmony (1970s)
DESCRIPTION: This a very rare bottle of Johnnie Walker Old Harmony, thought to have been produced back in the 1970s. Old Harmony was originally released exclusively in Japan. This is a 35cl bottling.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: GlenDronach - Hand Filled 2008 - Cask #2992
DESCRIPTION:
A Distillery Exclusive from Glendronach has been hand filled straight from the cask, at cask strength of 61.7% ABV.
Distilled on the 17th of September 2008, aged in oloroso cask number sw/2992 and bottled on 23rd August 2020.
This is bottle number 54.

NAME: Longmorn - 21 Year Old 1992 Old Particular
DESCRIPTION: Only 289 bottles of this Longmorn single malt scotch whisky have been bottled. Distilled in October 1992, matured for 21 years in refill hogshead DL10188 before being bottled by the family-owned firm Douglas Laing for their Old Particular Range.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 1032.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blasda (Limited Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2008, Ardbeg Blasda is a lesser-peated version of many people's favourite Islay malt, being just 8ppm in bottle (as opposed to the standard 10yo's 23ppm).  It is described as 'a lighter taste of Islay.' It has hints of sweets and chocolates for a pleasant accompaniment to the mild characteristic Ardbeg peaty tones. After all, 'Blasda' in Gaelic means 'sweet and delicious.'

NAME: Glenfarclas - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is exceptional and presented in a case with the gold logo on the front. 
25 Year Old - 43% ABV, 70cl.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Port Wood
DESCRIPTION: A rare and discontinued 1990s Glenmorangie Port Wood Finish.  Aged for at least 12 years in American oak casks before being finished in Port pipes.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Tomatin - 21 Year Old - Batch 1 - That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
The first independent bottling of Tomatin single malt Scotch whisky from That Boutique-y Whisky Company is a caramel-rich 21 year old expression
This bottle is from batch 1 and is one of 304 individually numbered bottles. 
This is bottle number 251.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1992 Valinch 'God Save the Queen'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
This bottles celebrates the Diamond Jubilee of the Queen, with cask 516/R02. It was distilled in 12.02.1992 and aged for 20 years. 
 
This is bottle 59 of 250 & is signed.

NAME: Mortlach - 25 Year Old  Gordon & Macphail Distillery Labels
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Part of their distillery labels collection, this well aged Mortlach is a must-try. the range is testimony to the long-standing relationship that G&M have with the distilleries.

NAME: Mortlach - 25 Year Old  Gordon & Macphail Distillery Labels
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Part of their distillery labels collection, this well aged Mortlach is a must-try. the range is testimony to the long-standing relationship that G&M have with the distilleries.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2007 Moine Oloroso - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in December 2007, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 10 years -  fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks.
This was a limited release of just 1881 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.

NAME: Aultmore - 28 Year Old - Batch #13 - That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company is a specialist in limited edition and small-batch single malt whiskies, single grains and bourbons. They have been winning awards for quite some time now for great expression and have gathered quite the cult following. They are very recognisable by the label on each bottle being in a graphic novel style drawing. Each label has a great connection with the whiskies that bottle encases. 
This bottle is from the 13th Batch of Aultmore.  This is a numbered bottle and one of 718 produced, bottled at 48.1%.

NAME: Dufftown - 20 Year Old 1999 - Adelphi #2140
DESCRIPTION: A single cask 1999 vintage Dufftown bottled by Adelphi in 2019 at the cask strength of 58%. Matured in cask #2140 for 20 years, this was one of only 238 bottles available.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 Spanish Oak Finish - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2002, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 15 years - it was initially aged in whisky refill cask and then in 2013 it was allowed a finishing period in Spanish oak Gran Reserva casks.  This was a limited release of just 1500 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.
Bottle 1181.

NAME: Glenallachie - 13 Year Old 2006 Single Cask #6601 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask release was specially selected for the 2020 Spirit of Speyside festival.  Distilled on the 19th of June 2006 and has been aged 13 years in a single PX Hogshead  #6601. 
This is one of 332 bottles.
This is bottle number 23.

NAME: Chivas Regal - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This Chivas Regal 25 year old is a delicious blend, with notes of peach and almond. It comes in a striking presentation box. 
This bottle is number 1106449.

NAME: Aberfeldy - 20 Year Old - Exceptional Cask Series
DESCRIPTION: Part of the Exceptional Cask Series this 20 year old is from small batch AB2798. Taken from casks #6,7,8,9,10.18 & #120. This is one of 3600 bottles.

NAME: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Screen Print 1990s
DESCRIPTION: This striking older-style presentation of Bowmore 10 Year Old single malt from the now highly sought screened label bottlings that were released between 1990 and 1995.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019 (With Macallan Bag)
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Ardbeg - Ardbog 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2013 for Ardbeg Day during Fèis Ìsle, Ardbog is a 10-Year-Old single malt by Ardbeg.  It is made from a vatting of whisky matured in a combination of bourbon casks and manzanilla casks, creating a balanced soft, sweet and earthy flavour.  In the World Whiskies Awards 2014, Ardbog won Best Islay Whisky NAS.
This is a 5cl bottling.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 14 Year Old (2005) Burgundy Finish
DESCRIPTION: This Bunnahabhain was distilled in late 2005 and was matured in refill whisky hogsheads before being transferred Burgundy wine casks for the rest of the maturation period. This is one of 600 bottles.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2004 PX - Coterie
DESCRIPTION: This  Bunnahabhain expression was released exclusively for the Coterie Club members. It was distilled in 2004 and matured for 15 years then finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks  for 6 years.  This bottle was hand-filled at the distillery.

NAME: Ardbeg - Kelpie - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

NAME: Lagavulin - 12 Year Old 2016 Special Release 200th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
The Lagavulin 12 year old, released in 2016 is of a very different style and is a limited release.  
The finish on this lovely dram is long-lasting and powerful.

NAME: Macallan - Gold (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.
This is a limited edition bottling.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 18 Year Old Small Batch
DESCRIPTION: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range and it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

NAME: Tullibardine - 14 Year Old Whisky Broker #33 2006
DESCRIPTION:
Tullibardine has been producing since 1949 and is located in Blackford. Unfortunately, the distillery was mothballed in 1995 by Whyte & Mackay. Tullibardine was sold in 2003 and in 2011, the distillery was sold to Picard Vins & Spiritueux. Several types of malt is produced including aged Oak Edition Single Malt Whisky and a nice Sherry Finish dram.
This bottling was done for Whisky Broker and is a 14 year old expression that has been aged in a first fill sherry butt #33. Only 662 bottles were produced and it was bottled 21.08.2020

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Port Charlotte - 16 year Old Heavily Peated Feis 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This super heavily peated malt is the oldest release in the series. It was distilled in 2003 and Bruoichladdich used only Scottish barely. Only 3000 bottles were produced at 55.8% Abv. 
Casks used -
Refill Hogshead - Then recasked to bourbon barrels in 2012.
Firstfill Bourbon Barrels - Then recasked into ex-Sauternes casks in 2013.
Ex Sherry / Ex Bourbon and Virgin Oak.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A smart old bottle of Laphroaig, bottled in the mid to late 1990s, after the award of the Royal Warrant in 1994. Laphroaig 15 Year Old is smoother than the robust 10-year-old.

NAME: Laphroaig - 12 Year Old - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Saint Magnus (Edition 2)
DESCRIPTION:
Saint Magnus of Orkney Bottling, follows the initial Earl Magnus release.  It is the second release in the trilogy, it comes in a wooden presentation box like the 12 year old and was bottled at the cask strength of 55%.
Only 11,994 bottles of Saint Magnus were created.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

NAME: Highland Park - Tampa Bay Edition Single Cask Series #699 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the very large series of single casks produced by the Orcadian distillery, Highland Park. This is the Tampa Bay edition which is a 10 year old from a refill hogshead. 
It was distilled in 2007 and bottled in 2017 from cask #699.

NAME: Glenallachie - 13 Year Old 2006 Single Cask #6601 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask release was specially selected for the 2020 Spirit of Speyside festival.  Distilled on the 19th of June 2006 and has been aged 13 years in a single PX Hogshead  #6601. 
This is one of 332 bottles.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 2960.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove 2016
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Glen Moray - Cider Cask Project
DESCRIPTION: This is a UK exclusive experimental release from Glen Moray. This whisky has been finished in ones that were previously used to hold Thistly Cross Scottish craft cider.  This is a small batch bottling and this is one of just 2000 bottles produced.

NAME: Glenallachie - 18 Year Old Cask #4152 2001 Uk Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
This single cask was distilled in 2001 and bottled August 2019. Cask #4152 was a PX Higshead and yielded 307 bottles. 
Bottle 151.

NAME: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Babe 1990 Valinch
DESCRIPTION:
Famous for its Whisky and now its Gin this is an early bottling that celebrates the Middle White Pig Society visit to the distillery on Islay. 
The distillery now instantly recognisable due to its unique colour is owned by Rémy Cointreau. 
This is from a refill Sherry Butt.
Distilled on 5th Sept 1990 and bottled on 5/12/2003 from Cask number 3666.
Bottle 225.

NAME: Springbank - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 18-year-old is full of authority and is truly a classic, full-bodied dram. With a delicious nose, this whisky will tempt you in and hold your attention as you uncover its unique palate and finish.

NAME: Highland Park - Quercus - Keystone Series 3rd Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 3rd release, from Highland Park, Quercus.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the kind of Oak used to make their casks. They are sent to Spain (Jerez) in order to in sherry before returning to the distillery. 
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv.
